top_comment.text:
Couscous is NOT Lebanese. And you'll never find anything like this as 
street food in Lebanon.
Sincerely,
A Lebanese.﻿
top_comment.author: Gracia STEPHAN

comments.text:
I don't recall him saying that Couscous is Lebanese.
He said 'Lebanese *street roast chicken* with Couscous".
NOT 'Street roast chicken with Couscous that's Lebanese'.
So please, at least try to think before writing criticism.
comments.author: John Bello

comments.text:
i see you complain on every video, I couldnt give a shit if its not 100% 
lebanese so stfu
comments.author: Dicky Mchead

top_comment.text:
I wish you guys would not call bullion disolved in boiling water, "chicken 
stock"! That is msg-laden chicken flavoring. I am surprised you are not 
promoting taking that glorious chicken carcass and making a valid chicken 
stock ... in my humble opinion!﻿
top_comment.author: Roslyn Rawls

comments.text:
Won't look for "bullion cubes". I try to always have homemade stock in my 
freezer!
comments.author: Roslyn Rawls

comments.text:
I don't know what kind of bullion cubes you're getting, but if they're 
"msg-laden" then you might want to look into a different brand.
comments.author: curlywonders
